name: Heidi Hanchey
text: Super nice owner. She was very patience and helpful with all my questions.

resp.text:
I really appreciate your comments.  It was a pleasure serving you.
Jan

name: stephen greer
text: Really great local art store. They have  a great selection of art supplies and a lot of local art for sale. I have always had a friendly smile greet me and great conversation. Thank you for everything.

resp.text: Thanks for the great comments.  I always have said we actually like each other in Foley.  It’s always a pleasure to talk to people.

name: Melody Carroll
text: We are from Indy. We had never been in this shop before and it was one of the best experiences I have had in the 20+ years of coming to Foley. The owner was amazing and very informative. I picked her brain about a lot of art mediums and learned so much. Bought some beautiful local art.  It is cash or check only but it's worth it!

name: Ron Carlson
text: Thanks Jan had a great time learning more. Hope to be back next year. I learn more every time I am at one of your classes.

name: Johnny Wood
text: Very friendly shop with lots of nice things. Will definitely shop there again.

name: Ron Carlson
text: Very nice friendly great store wonderful teacher. Thanks Jan for helping with my ink drawings I always learn just a little more every year. I hope to be back

resp.text:
Thank you.  It means a lot to know that
I’m making a difference.

name: Tammy Nance
text:
Great supplier of quality art products.
Clean convenient location.
Plenty of cool, local art for sale.
Great prices.
Kind helpful staff.

name: Ronda Watts
text:
My daughter takes art classes with Jan at Jan's Art Studio and absolutely loves it!
Jan is extremely patient, thorough and cares about her students.
I enjoy taking in all of the unique art pieces in her studio,  from one of a kind pottery, paintings and even jewelry!

name: Charlie Ray
text: This is a wonderful small Huntsville history center full to the brim with one of a kind artifacts and historical memorabilia. The owners are kind and super fun to talk to. Please visit and look at all the art, history, and listen to stories about the people who really made and build Huntsville Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We appreciate your feedback and are so happy you enjoyed visiting the gallery and museum!

name: Clay Harris
text: Mr. Stevenson is a great artist and an even better person!  If you ever get a chance to carry on just a small conversation with the man, I promise it will be enlightening plus well worth your time.

name: John Jackson
text: Brilliant work. I have several pieces hanging in my home.

name: Alaina Keene
text: I have been going here for 3 years and Love it! The community is extremely welcoming, it is very easy to feel comfortable with being on stage and being confident in your self in general. I did 2 shows and felt welcomed enough to make a huge commitment and join their traveling competition team. Two and a half years later I spend 6 days of my week at the center, learning and hanging out with this amazing community that is like a family. I totally recommend you send your child here if they are interested in a fun environment to learn about the arts!

name: Alisa Loyd
text: So many activities your child will love it. Has a one big family feel between kids and parents alike!!

name: Shunta' King
text: Great place to start! I was looking for a place for my 4yr old to use some of her creative side in a very constructive way! She loves it! The staff is  very friendly and very welcoming. The prices are great !  I really like the fact that the instructors use the time scheduled to put a show together. That  speaks volumes!  Money well spent! My daughter is new to the culture and she loves it! Looking forward to great things along with great development!

name: The Squad
text: Chris Paragone the drama teacher of Sunnyside theater is a outstanding and compassionate human being. LOVES his students. Puts in long long hours with them. Should be awarded a Golden Apple award.Excellent place of performing Arts.

name: Andre Kistner
text: Great teachers.

name: Rainy Day
text: I don't know everything that they do here, but I've been here for swing dancing and for an acting competition. It's a building with an insane amount of rooms. They have rooms with mirrors on the walls for ballet and dance. There's rooms for small groups to practice music and there's props for acting groups. I believe there's a stage down stairs, but I can't be certain. If you're a parent who has children that like to dance or act. I think this would be a place to check out.

name: Michael Vanden Heuvel
text: This place is awesome! The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgable. I've been meeting with Chris Duncan for a few weeks for ukulele lessons and he is incredibly talented and a fantastic teacher. I'm an absolute beginner when it comes to any and all instruments but he has been breaking it down for me each week so that it is pretty easy for me to digest. If the other instructors are like chris then you cannot go wrong taking yourself or your child here. Highly recommended!

name: Michelle C
text: Great school for the arts with teachers that care. Uniqueness is celebrated but is a religious themed organization.

name: Ricci Allen
text: What a wonderful place to learn and grow through a variety of dance!

name: Dark Neko
text: Love Sunnyside theater

name: Joyelle Wilson
text: Phenomenal Irish dance classes

name: Melissa Mills
text: Wonderful Irish dance classes

name: Daniel Driskell
text: I'm glad my kids are involved at the the ACCA!

name: Seth’s World vlogs
text: Its cool

name: April Craft
text: Wonderful place

name: Eve Niles
text:
Such an innovative and fun experience. Any age can create! I took my 7-year-old daughter and instructors were attentive, helpful, and patient with her. This could be anything from a fun family event to a nice date night!

We will definitely be back!

resp.text:
Eve...you and Paris did a great job...I can not wait until the pieces have been fired. Your daughter did an amazing job ALL by herself, she knew exactly how to break down the shapes and I think like grinding! : )
Thank you for giving me the opportunity to serve you and yours! You are going to have to bring your husband in next time!

name: Cresta Christensen
text: Such an awesome experience! My daughter and I went here for the first time yesterday and had a great time! Josh is a very patient, knowledgeable and friendly instructor. Very creative, organized atmosphere. We are already planning our next trip! Also... CALL THE STUDIO BEFORE YOU PURCHASE A GROUPON! Josh will honor that price without you having to purchase over Groupon, but he doesn’t lose a large percentage of the commission. So if you plan on going, just call the studio first! And you should DEFINITELY plan on going!

resp.text: Cresta it was a blast having you in the store. You and your daughter both did some really cool stuff. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Laura Brown
text: I really enjoyed the variety of designs and the unique challenges of designing glass pieces. A new and welcome experience!

resp.text: Laura I am glad you enjoyed the time you spent in the store creating. I appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!

name: Denise Tevis
text: Josh and Lana are knowledgeable, helpful, and so friendly. They have a nice selection of tools and glass, including a discount glass section. My partner and I drove from Altanta to Dallas to buy glass for our stained glass projects. The owners answered all our questions and offered helpful tips and suggestions. We found everything we needed. Worth the drive—would definitely come here again!

resp.text: Denise so glad you stopped by and visited us at the store. Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you and your glass needs!

name: Abby Barton (abbyheartsbooks)
text: I have ZERO artistic talent and went into the class with no idea of what I wanted to do. Josh and his wife were AMAZING at easing my nerves and showing me how I can create a beautiful bowl regardless of my lack of talent. I went with friends (all of our first time there) and we had THE BEST TIME learning how to cut and shape glass. Josh was very good at explaining everything we needed to know. All my friends and myself agreed that we will keep going back to make more pieces. I HIGHLY recommend this class for mental/emotional therapy, date nights, friends bonding time, and any other reason you can come up with!

resp.text:
Abby...
Thank you so very much for giving me the opportunity to serve you and yours! It makes me extremely happy to know you had a great experience. As you have already been back to the store shows how much you enjoyed the process. Again thank you, will call soon to let you know your second piece is ready to pickup!

name: Heather Taylor
text: Fantastic experience!! Me & my best friend were wanting a fun new adventure.. a new thing to try.. a new creative outlet and this didn’t disappoint! We thoroughly enjoyed our evening, Josh and his wife were super helpful, so easy going & fun to be around, and all around wonderful!! Josh helped me make a bird for my piece and it was exactly what I wanted! They’re there to help but easily stand aside and let you and your creativity do your thing! ♥️♥️ I cant wait to go back and get our other bestie in on the fun!! I cannot wait to get my finished piece now!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming, so glad you had a great time! Can not wait to see you and all of your besties! See you soon!

name: Belinda Barker
text: I wanted a fun new activity for a friend's birthday and this was perfect!  Working with glass was intimidating at first but Josh's skill and patience made it easy and fun. He was especially terrific with my 10 year old daughter who was able to make a wonderful creation.  She wants to come back with all her friends, me too!

resp.text: Belinda...I am so glad that you, Jana and your daughter had a good time. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Denean Breed
text: My friends and I had a great time here.  We were able to make personalized, free-form creations on glass.  It was not at all a run-of-the-mill experience.  Jason was super helpful.  I am bringing my four teens soon for a little family time.  The experience takes about 2 hours.

resp.text: Thank you Denean...I am glad you had a great time. Hope to see you and the crew again soon. Please call the store as I still haven't had any contact with one of your party.

name: April P
text: Such a wonderful and  therapeutically calming experience.  Even if you've never done this before Josh is such a great instructor you'll be confident in work.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words April we will miss being in Dallas

name: A. Ray Harris, Jr.
text:
This PLACE IS AWESOME. My woman and I went on an Saturday morning in November. I was very apprehensive at first but ended the day loving my experience.

I made an Cigar ashtray and four coasters. Josh was very easy to undaunted and his glass cutting & breaking demonstrations will give you all the confidence you need to make an great piece of glass art.

resp.text: So happy you had a good time! Looking forward to seeing you again soon! I know Piece of Heaven Bakery next door will love seeing you Again as well! Tell Danielle to email me to confirm date and number of people coming next time!

name: Hannah Hutcherson
text: Josh and his wife were so amazing! Our first experience with infused glass and his guidance was great! You can tell them love for what they do definitely shows!! I win definitely be back 😊

resp.text: Hannah thank you so much I am glad you had a great time. Your pieces turned out great am sure you will be very pleased!

name: Jill Snelling
text: After months of search found Guidance Glass and now want to stand of the roof top and tell everyone!  I had purchased a gorgeous fixer upper corner cabinet with carved wood curved front and curved doors made of leaded glass.  Little did I know the difficulty of finding someone to replace broken panes!  Then I met Josh...he is the owner of the company and he changed everything.  He created beautiful curved pieces, took apart and replaced all the lead between the glass and then reinstalled it back onto the doors.  He even gave me choices if i wanted to update a color on certain sections.  He had great attention to detail, took his time to get it done the right way and was worth every penny.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

resp.text: Jill thank you for your kind words. I greatly appreciate you took the time to leave the review. The cabinet doors did look good once reinstalled. Thank you for giving me the opportunity to serve you! If I can be of any assistance in the future please let me know!

name: Jenn Mallett
text: We had so much fun fusing glass!

resp.text: Thank you so much will miss being in Dallas

name: Tina Altman
text: This was such a fun experience & I was really happy with how my project turned out. Josh was the best! He was so helpful & made sure we were satisfied with how everything looked. I’d definitely recommend this business :)

resp.text: I am so glad you had fun. I assume the coasters made it to you okay!

name: Joni Henderson
text: My sister and I went this weekend while we were traveling. We had a wonderful time. He was so helpful and patient. Recommend everyone to stop in and make wonderful art!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for stopping by on your visit to the Atlanta area. Next time you are in town stop by and build something else! I'll give you an out of town discount!

name: John Rowe
text:
Only going by previous ratings however, I am sooooooo excited to have stained glass back in this area.  I took lessons years ago on 92 in Hiram.  I love doing stained glass, while I  think I'm pretty good(MADE A PIECE with 207 pieces, my wife helped) I have so much to learn.  I'll be taking classes soon and I'll get back.
So far a 5 star just for being in Paulding County  - let's all help support this brave artist - talk about stained glass to everyone and especially Guidance Glass!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: John please make sure to come see me soon. As a school teacher we are only open Friday evenings, Saturday, and Sunday. I will work hard to outdo your expectations.

name: NY Grl
text: Josh is trying hard to give the art glass community what it wants and needs: a wide selection of glass and help from someone who knows and understands the glass artist. I hope his business expands and grows as the glass community finds out about him. Let's support this local business that's working hard to support us!

resp.text: I’m not sure who NGA GRL is but I greatly appreciate the support. Thank you for your kind words and encouragement. They were greatly needed.

name: britishcow
text: Got the groupon and it was definitely worth it. Great instructor.

resp.text: Thank you so much I am glad you enjoyed the experience. Hope to see you again soon!

name: George Astin
text: Fabulous original art by Jane Lee. A display of her seascapes and shell inspired wall hangings. She also has Christmas ornaments made from oyster shells that are unique.

name: Joyce Scarborough
text: Real nice place showcasing local artists and crafters works. Good place to purchase one of a kind handmade products! I'm hoping to get some of my mice in the shop. Friendly staff..very cordial and helpful.

name: Marsha J.
text: My grandson loves this place.

name: becky kinder
text: Only available local place for artists to display art for sale.  Helpful, pleasant staff. Charming vintage building.   Plenty of parking. Pleasant location across street from lovely park, tearoom and Medical Museum.  Nice to include in "casual lunch with girlfriend" afternoon.

name: Kathy Prince
text: Beautiful work from local artists at reasonable prices.  Very nice little shop!

name: Patricia O'Donnell
text: This is a quaint little art center in a beautiful downtown Foley.  This month they are showcasing the amazing art of Snook Christian Academy students. Stop in and check out Ben's Gotham Town Trilogy 😁

name: Bizzy Hyde
text: So neat! Picked up some local art pieces and got a great recommendation for lunch in the area

name: Zana S. Price
text: Always something new and wonderful from local Artists & Craftsmen. Great selection and prices. Friendly, helpful staff.

name: Jon Janda
text: Awesome collection of artists goods

name: Melanie Schnieders aka melonknee62
text: What is there not to love about this center that houses so many creative endeavors to purchase!  Wonderful staff & so many glorious works of art for sale!

name: Shirley Young
text: Beautiful local art, always friendly, new artistry each visit, very nice

name: Mary Nobles
text: It's always nice to walk around Foley and check out all our town has to offer . Our old town and new mixed . You must take the little ones around the train Station everyone i have taken there has truly enjoyed it . Take the dog kids , family and friends . Go have a burger at pirates cove where Jimmy Buffett sang Cheese burger in Paradise at . Longitude and latitude. Go down to Barbara's Marina and check out all the dinosaurs . You won't regret it one bit . Go to the Flora-Bama Lounge they have an awesome service at the Flora - Bama lounge and package store . If you have never been it's time to see what all the hoopla is all about . Try the Mullet Toss out . Then January the first try the polar  dip out . It's one of the most exciting times at the Flora-Bama  .you also need to try the Barefoot Bar , the Pink Pony out to . You really don't need an excuse to party . My sisters always told ne that you should party all month long on your Birthday . Make sure you tell your moms happy Birthing day .

name: Steve Pruett
text: Worth stopping in and looking around. Lots of local art.

name: Darlennia Payton
text: It was closed when we went.

name: Nanette Tingle
text: Had fun at the show

name: Jo_ann Hall
text: Over priced

name: Peggy Payne
text: Hours say 10-7 M9nday but its closed. :-(

name: Gary Anderson
text: The Huntsville Art League has a gallery in studio 2013 in Lowe Mill in Huntsville, Alabama. The gallery is a great one-stop shop to find unique, handmade paintings, drawings, prints, woodworking, pottery, jewelry, and more. Joining the Huntsville Art League is an excellent way to become involved with Lowe Mill and the local art community.

name: Janet Page
text: Wonderful selection of original art.

name: Art League President
text: HAL is an artists' cooperative.  Artists are given the opportunity to showcase their art in the popular Lowe Mill.  HAL is a "must stop" if you visit Lowe Mill.

name: Larry Johnson
text: Top flight! Wonderful staff and amenities

name: Sean McKim
text:
Great venue. We enjoyed seeing the Alabama Symphony here performing Disney classics. The sound was really good and the show was outstanding. The balcony gets a little high and there are a few stairs, but you can still see and hear everything very well.
Restrooms and concessions are downstairs. There are elevators that go from the basement up to 2M.

name: Bill Tiemann
text: Had an opportunity to visit this facility recently. It's a wonderful venue

name: Owen Stayner/ThisWorkplace360
text: I have been to many events here- always first class with good staff.

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
Came here during the holiday season to see The Nutcracker! Apparently Samford's production of the Nutcracker is one of about 8 that is officially certified to do it and it was great! During intermission, head downstairs EARLY if possible for some nice hot chocolate, candy or a Samford Bulldog Bar (if I remember correctly). Anyway, the facility is very nice! Large and well kept. Our seats were beneath the overhang of the balcony so I didn't get to see what kind of theater magic they used to accomplish this, but during intermission they even made it SNOW on the audience!

I'll be sure to keep an eye out for any other enticing productions taking place here!

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Beautiful campus

name: Bad News Gary Brown
text: Loved the time I was there.

name: Cocoa Young
text:
Working the Ticket Office on Today....
for The Nutcracker Performance.

name: Celesta Espinosa
text: The librarians and art director are so helpful and kind. My children and I feel very welcome here. Great programs for the community

name: Michele Hagood
text: Love the center .... but it's the people that make it

name: philip willingham
text: Love this place

name: Angela Trucks
text: Our granddaughter had her "end of the year cheerleading party," there.  She enjoyed herself. It's a great place to take the family. They offer paint classes, and parties for school, church, or just those who want to get out from under the technology and do something creative. Check them out!

name: Billy McLeod
text: small facility. seats are ok. mics and lites  work well. an asset to our community!

name: Stephanie Melton
text:
Great cast in the play! The outside seating area is delightful. The people are very warm and welcoming.
Go see a play! Way better than T.V.

name: Quite Marvelous
text: As always, phenomenal!

name: Stacey Steiner
text:
I got my wires crossed. I thought have they were having a matinee of Rocky Horror Show. I knew it was coming up. I am used to JJP and Chickasaw. I had tried to buy tickets online last night. I got there a few minutes before 1:00 and waited until someone showed up to find out they aren't open on Sundays.

At least now I know why I haven't been there in a while! My fault, not theirs but I really enjoy Sunday matinees!

name: JR H
text: It was sold out on the last showing here so I did not choose to stay. But the local actors, directors and others do a great job here. I missed seeing a Steven Sondheim play here that must have been very well done since it sold out on the last show.

name: Candace Foster
text: The best theatre around! Dark & intimate, like a black box theatre. I love the mysterious vibe & the variety of shows put on. A theatre for all--especially if you're tired of the same old thing. Also, an awesome date night venue!

name: Sarah Parks
text: We really enjoyed the play. Just wasn't a good atmosphere for small children.  They serve alcohol and the workers where all drinking .

name: Lethel Brown
text: Nice and friendly peoples love this place

name: Aundrea Couchcrowley
text: The cast was superb in this 4 person play!

name: Marshall Mears
text: Best time. Comfort.

name: Bill Marinello
text: Never went

name: Kim Miller
text: Awesome

name: susan vinson
text: My favorite theatre in Mobile!

name: Robin Bierworth
text: This place is wonderful 😊 They have many shops inside where you can find art, sweets and that special something. They also give the opportunity for local artists to come out and set up a tent/booth every Saturday! It's a great way to spend the day or even a few hours 😉. Definitely recommend this place 👍👍

name: Vic R
text: I enjoy visiting and browsing the vendors shops and checking out the art exhibits featuring local artists. The exhibits rotate so you will see new work often. There are a few good food options on site. They do outdoor concerts here as well; plenty of things for the family

name: Maria Lechtreck
text: This is such a wonderful and remarkable place.  But when I visited on the Saturday of the Memorial Day weekend 2021, along with tons of other visitors, it was disappointing that so few artists were in their studios to meet the visitors and share their stories and sell their creations.  I hope the artists will soon transition into a much faster recovery from COVID.

name: Davida Holiday
text: There are so many things to see, do, and taste at the Lowe Mill! I would recommend that you go on a Saturday (unless you are going for food, treats, or drinks then when they are open anytime is fine, because things right now (probably due to focus) are not really hopping on other days. Everything you see is eye candy! And oh my word, it is so worth it! Great place to take pictures as well!!! So go and soothe your soul with the art and satiate your taste buds with great did and yummy treats!

name: Aaron D. Lee
text: Huntsville staple. Went to shows there back in the early aughts and it is astounding how much it has grown. Check out Guadalupe's pottery (world-class) and Pizelles for some amazing (but definitely upscale-priced) chocolates, coffee, and Italian-style sodas.

name: Sue sad
text: Me and hubby checking out the art nice place to pick up things for the home plenty of  vendors to choose from outside and in try the tea 😋❣

name: Wendy Boustani
text: Really fun and eclectic maker shops. Good on-site eatery. Wall art and public areas are interesting to wander through. Highly recommend for local residents but especially as a pleasant low-key activity to bring out-of-town relatives.

name: Susan Wilke
text: We loved walking around and seeing the artists.  The dragon themed coffee shop was so fun.  Also loved Calvin Hubbard's pottery -- a must see on ground floor of building with dinosaur entrance.  He had many decorative and functional items.  We got a beautiful bowl & mug for a very reasonable price.  💖😊 He was also very friendly and fun to talk to with many years experience making pottery.

name: Debra Jeffery
text: Only visited the first floor, and the outside  areas. Next will be the 2nd floor. My first visit to the Mill, Awesome!  Soo much Talent, Thank you everyone for sharing.

name: J Michael Cobb
text: An incredible location.  A.grand event space.

name: Kayra Dunn
text: Love the atmosphere.  Unique places to eat.  Very different to the usual food.  Got Orchard Peach tea.  Very good.  Follows the safety rules with mask and distancing.

name: Kacey Clark
text: Amazing food. Amazing art. Exciting activities. 10/10. Don't forget to visit the Dragon Forge Cafe!

name: Makenna Gott
text: This is SUCH a cool place!!! So much to see, I didn't have enough time! Can't wait to go back!

name: Lindsay Richer
text:
Beautiful location and building. The outside vendors were sparse and many of the inside vendors were closed. But I can presume this is due to the lingering effects of social distancing.

Our lunch from Poftà Bunà was AMAZING, the tea from Piper & Leaf was outstanding, and sitting outside was perfect.

name: Brandon Whaley
text: A fun place to do all kinds of things. Great for the family as well.

name: C B
text: The Mill is a phenomenal place. No matter who you are and what your interests are,..you can be at home at the mill. The Artists are awesome to shop with and talk to, the Events are Great. Its definitely a place that can enrich you and broaden your spectrums. I love the mill Alone, with My Husband, with my Kids, with my Friends.

name: Hismione Tremblay
text: Over all, a rather nice assortment of artistic venues and store fronts.  Two of the stairwells smell of bat guano due to the bats that inhabit them, which makes me wonder about health code violations due to all the diseases bats can carry, such as rabies for example.   The only elevator we could find was a service use only, not public use.  This would seem to make the building less accessible for those who might need assistance or who have strollers, which we did today.

name: Ryan S
text: Really enjoy going and walking around, looking at all the shops. Lots of amazing artists. A wonderful place to support local. Green pea press on the first floor and Artimaps on the third floor are a couple of my favorite places to visit! Great places to eat, like "The Happy Tummy". Can spend a couple hours here enjoying the beautiful surroundings. Lots of murals and art work throughout the building.

name: James Franklin
text: A real variety of things to see a lot of Talent on display well worth going to

name: Kyle Gott
text: This place is freaking sweet. We went last summer so a lot of places were closed due to COVID. I am looking forward to going this summer to see it with everything open. So many neat local artists and companies there. It’s a very old building so it’s cool how they repurposed it but it still has some of the old structure vibes.

name: Joe Masters
text: This place is so cool. I wish we had something like this at home. It's worth a trip to Huntsville just to go shop here. And bring the dog!

name: Cara Hoffman
text: Fantastic place to see, buy, and learn to make art, along with meeting artists, and watching their processes. Unique food and drink. Diversity and acceptance.

name: Shaun Bloodsworth
text: Always a great place to go enjoy some quiet and walk around. Plenty of amazing artists to visit in their studios, and lots of good food and drink!

name: melissa
text: My children and I LOVE Lowe mill. We always make it a point to go to Dragon's Cafe each time we go.The raspberry Danish? Cookies are so delicious! We get them everytime. We've been trying different teas and coffees on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Lowe mill is just such a unique and fun place. We could spend hours walking the halls and looking at all the artwork and different shops.

name: Dylan Clark
text: You can never have a bad time at Lowe Mill. There's always something to see or do, and every visit manages to be a unique experience even after a dozen trips. Definitely a great place to spend your day & money at - especially for supporting the local community.

name: Abster_ Abbs
text: It's so beautiful there! One of my favorite places to go! Love seeing all the different art and even seeing some of the artist work!

name: Shannon Boyd
text: Amazing Arts and Custom Crafts venue. Individual artists' offerings in a wonderful venue ripe for exploring.  Come when you have plenty of time to explore all three floors. There are even food offerings to keep you fueled.

name: Jessica Flores
text: The people working there are very very very rude!! You had an employee walking around yelling at people to put on their mask ( which they were taking prom pictures) and told a grown man that he should know better and called him Sassy ... I will Never step foot on this property again.

name: Abster_ Abbs
text: It's so beautiful there! One of my favorite places to go! Love seeing all the different art and even seeing some of the artist work!

name: Shaun Bloodsworth
text: Always a great place to go enjoy some quiet and walk around. Plenty of amazing artists to visit in their studios, and lots of good food and drink!

name: melissa
text: My children and I LOVE Lowe mill. We always make it a point to go to Dragon's Cafe each time we go.The raspberry Danish? Cookies are so delicious! We get them everytime. We've been trying different teas and coffees on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Lowe mill is just such a unique and fun place. We could spend hours walking the halls and looking at all the artwork and different shops.

name: Dylan Clark
text: You can never have a bad time at Lowe Mill. There's always something to see or do, and every visit manages to be a unique experience even after a dozen trips. Definitely a great place to spend your day & money at - especially for supporting the local community.

name: Jessica Flores
text: The people working there are very very very rude!! You had an employee walking around yelling at people to put on their mask ( which they were taking prom pictures) and told a grown man that he should know better and called him Sassy ... I will Never step foot on this property again.

name: Gabriel Haroldson
text: Took my family here over Thanksgiving break. It is a beautiful building and there are lots of different art exhibits and shops inside the building. This is not for families with little kids. They had some pornography type photos and drawings. I think they need a 18+ so people know a head of time. I won’t be bringing my family back here.

name: Brian Keefe
text: So many unique shops and artist.  Great way to spend a Saturday just exploring

name: Stormcrow
text: Great hip place. Lots to do and see

name: Roberto Martins
text:
Amazing space with lots to see. It has a metropolitan vibe that reminds me of New York and Miami's Art Basel, without the crowds of course.

Super enjoyable experience!

name: K Wynn, the Conscious Lifestyle Enthusiast
text: I really enjoy this venue, the atmosphere, and the food is okay. Most of the staff are pretty cool; however, the bartenders are not that friendly with exception of one who is really great! Whoever heard of a bartender(s) needing to work on social skills, right? I'm here supporting R&B Vibes every Tuesday night, so are quite a few other people. Please address the unfriendliness.

name: Erika
text: I love everything about this place. The food and shopping options are excellent. The atmosphere is fun and friendly. I love the exhibitions they have. Fun for hanging out and having date night.

name: Jenni Lanham
text: Expected more booths/shops to be open on a Saturday afternoon.   Really disappointing since we'd brought out of town guests to find unique items.   Not sure we'll ever go back since as this is the second time it's been like this.  Christmas is in 5 weekss so you'd think they'd want to make some money. Best part about the trip was the nice gentleman running the elevator.

name: Robin Settle
text: This is a fun place to walk around. I really like the tea shop.  The guitar shop was neat to visit, also. A lot of the art is not my style and some of it I cannot imagine having in my house (like the painting of the tampon on a bright pink background), but there is also some really cool stuff. Overall, a fun and eclectic experience nut one I only need occassionally.

name: Marcia Taritero
text: Enjoyed The Veggie! Delicious vegan food!

name: James Capps
text: A good place to go and relax a little expensive but good environment.

name: Timothy McCulloch
text: I visited the record store & absolutely loved it. They have a great selection & if ya can't find what you're looking for then they order it. Definitely recommend!

name: JOAN VARGAS
text: Need better sign out side to find its location

name: Jason Ray
text: Amazing community for the arts and artists. Highly recommended.

name: JK C
text: Please support your local artist.  This place along with 805 and a few others are pretty cool to go to.

name: Evans Mcbride
text: The Veggie restaurant is the place to eat. It is my go to  place . That food is good.

name: Robin Settle
text: This is a fun place to walk around. I really like the tea shop.  The guitar shop was neat to visit, also. A lot of the art is not my style and some of it I cannot imagine having in my house (like the painting of the tampon on a bright pink background), but there is also some really cool stuff. Overall, a fun and eclectic experience nut one I only need occassionally.

text: I visited the record store & absolutely loved it. They have a great selection & if ya can't find what you're looking for then they order it. Definitely recommend!

name: JOAN VARGAS
text: Need better sign out side to find its location

name: James Capps
text: A good place to go and relax a little expensive but good environment.

name: Marcia Taritero
text: Enjoyed The Veggie! Delicious vegan food!

name: Pitts Burgher
text: Everyone should go and see all of the local artist and crafters who have their stores set up there. Food and drink are available. Check out 5 Points Elements. Great store.

name: Hector Murrieta
text: Great place to hang out, see art, listen to music, places to paint, etc. Definitely worth a visit (or a dozen).

name: Carla Davis
text:
We set up to sell our jewelry on Saturdays. I am disappointed that there are not more customers people buying to support the artists but the exposure is awesome and we enjoyed networking with other artists and the art community. The only people who bought our art we're from out of town. Get out there Huntsville and support the arts better! Bobby is a killer hairstylist and the food is awesome. Great place to take kids if your looking for something to do in Huntsville.
Lowe Mill is a great place and a must see!

name: Beth Taylor
text: What a fun way to #buylocal! There's really something for everyone, whether you're trying to find a unique gift for a friend or just would like to try some fresh kombucha this is the place for you!

name: Rita Whatley
text:
First time to visit. Was interesting
To see all the different  art . Never been ?.worth giving it a once over.

name: Sophia
text: Beautiful building with lots of fun things to do. I love the STEAM center there and I'm sad to see it go. Still a fun place to go even without the STEAMworks.

name: Harper W. Avent
text: Always a fun place to go for art, food, drinks, or jsut to walk around and hang out. There are so many different stores and vendors here. It seems like there is always something going on around the mill. It never gets old!

name: Stephanie Schrenk
text: There is so much to do and discover at lowe mill! There is always rotating art exhibits so there's always new art to look at, I love going into the artist studios and seeing their stuff for sale and the amazing things they create, and also there are delicious restaurants and an adorable cat cafe. There's also cool things to do like take classes and go to events, so there is always something that you will like or something that you will want to get into at lowe mill.

name: kimbolinarino
text: Important epicenter of art for the greater huntsville community. Has grown tenfold since it's humble beginnings as mostly a venue for local obscure bands and makers, as well as photographers in the early days with just a few anchored shops. Now has studios on every floor, restaurants, a community garden, shops, concerts, classes, all kinds of really awesome stuff and people under one roof. Cultural jewel of Huntsville.

name: Alex P
text: Cool atmosphere, lots of interesting products and services. A great time whether you're going just to walk around or to attend an event or festival.

name: Heather Whitmore
text: Lowe Mill is a great place to find unique gifts and decor for your home. I love supporting the local artists and enjoy their art classes, shows,  and restaurants. We went the other night to grab dinner and watch the "concert on the dock".  The weather was gorgeous and everyone was super friendly.  Had a great time and plan to go again next Friday.

name: Dan P
text: Fun place to hang out, appreciate creativity and art, I would also recommend as an option to anyone looking for a place to buy gifts.

name: Chloe C
text: One of my favorite places in Huntsville. I love all the artists here, whether current or artists that have left. I am biased though seeing as I basically grew up here. Lowe Mill offers some of the most fun events like Comic Con, concerts on the dock, and more. 10/10 would go again

name: Emaley Thomas
text: Absolutely wonderful facility & several excellent art galleries, shops, tea shop, and eateries. Gorgeous grounds & is filled with wonderful souls. Truly one 9f my favorite spots

name: Christy Lang
text: Love the outdoor spaces that are used for community events such as concerts & drive-in movies. Also like walking through the building to see local artists & vendors with their wares. It's quirky & fun.

name: Joanna DeAtley
text: Wonderful place full of amazing art and amazing people.  You'll find anything and everything here from sculptures to paintings to jewelry and more.   There are fantastic spots for food and drink as well.  The whole place is dog friendly and many of the artists adore having dogs visit. It's a great place for a family day.

name: Christopher Hall
text: Im a strong supporter of small business but was told several times I looked like I didn't belong there or I probably didn't have enough money to even be shopping in several of the shops will not be back unless these people can fix there overall attitude thinking they're better than everyone else.

name: Brian White
text: Great wholesome fun for the whole family. Perfect for a date night too. Love this place. Huntsville is lucky to have a place like this.

name: Stephanie Schrenk
text: There is so much to do and discover at lowe mill! There is always rotating art exhibits so there's always new art to look at, I love going into the artist studios and seeing their stuff for sale and the amazing things they create, and also there are delicious restaurants and an adorable cat cafe. There's also cool things to do like take classes and go to events, so there is always something that you will like or something that you will want to get into at lowe mill.

name: Frank Noor
text:
Wow! What a great chill environment. I loved my first time there and will always remember that. Have made plans to make this a regular place to visit.......they always jave events and drive in movies! Great place for a date, a lunch, or just a family outing.

You owe it to yourself to check this spot out,especially if you are in the Huntsville area. Hope you all enjoy it as much as I have

name: Harper W. Avent
text: Always a fun place to go for art, food, drinks, or jsut to walk around and hang out. There are so many different stores and vendors here. It seems like there is always something going on around the mill. It never gets old!

name: Sophia
text: Beautiful building with lots of fun things to do. I love the STEAM center there and I'm sad to see it go. Still a fun place to go even without the STEAMworks.

name: Jenny Lassetter
text: It was our first time there and although we only made it through the expansive first floor we will be visiting again.

name: kimbolinarino
text: Important epicenter of art for the greater huntsville community. Has grown tenfold since it's humble beginnings as mostly a venue for local obscure bands and makers, as well as photographers in the early days with just a few anchored shops. Now has studios on every floor, restaurants, a community garden, shops, concerts, classes, all kinds of really awesome stuff and people under one roof. Cultural jewel of Huntsville.

name: Alura Garrison
text:
This is not only a place that supports local artists, but they also host many fun and helpful events like the A New Leash On Life adoption event/celebration! This is where Todd found his furever family!!!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️
There are some awesome local artists inside, too - gifts for men, women, kids, you name it, and there's probably an artist of that genre there.  Also, Happy Tummy has the BEST lunch foods ever. I used to eat there all the time when I worked at the genomics company that used to be on the other side.
I hear The Chef's food truck outside is fabulous too.

name: Essie Carpenter
text: One of my favorite creative spaces. Great for every member of the family!!!

name: Streeter Michael
text: Pizzells is awesome very good and out of the box chocolate. What a unique way to do a smores

name: susan glandon
text: Such a great place, with a variety of food, dessert, and shopping!

name: Chris Pittson
text: Nice to walk and look around and shop.

name: Jk R
text: Awesome place, great artists just beware the hipsters

name: Tara W.
text: Loved all the local art. And studios there!

name: Joanna DeAtley
text: Wonderful place full of amazing art and amazing people.  You'll find anything and everything here from sculptures to paintings to jewelry and more.   There are fantastic spots for food and drink as well.  The whole place is dog friendly and many of the artists adore having dogs visit. It's a great place for a family day.

name: Erik Walsh
text: Cool art spot with tons to check out.

name: brodie lowery
text: Such a wonderful place! Great shops, restaurants,entertainment and art. There is something for everyone in the family.

name: Jenn Ryan
text:
If you haven't had the chance to visit this place then you are really missing out in one of the hidden gems of Huntsville Alabama. There is absolutely something for everyone here, from one of kind art pieces, to classes, to chocolates, whiskey, ice cream, coffee, sandwiches and painted pieces for your favorite boardgame. Each time I am here I find a new corner to explore, a new food truck to enjoy or a new tea from the tea shop. I cannot wait for my next visit.

If you happen here make sure you check out their live schedule because sometimes there are bands playing, or maybe a poet or two. You never know what you find and where in the Lowest Mill you might find it.

Art, chocolates and tea pictures attached so you can see what I am talking about. Piper and Leaf...I highly recommend everything on the menu. A good start for a good shopping trip.

name: Tim Edwards
text: Plenty of parking.   Little difficult to find.   Lots of great artists and lots of walking.. several restaurants.

name: Joey Ellerbee
text: Liked getting lost in this place. Very cool.

name: MV Freeman
text:
This is a fabulous place with wonderful artist studios, a confection shop, coffee shop, tea shop and a Mediterranean place-- but the food is the side bar (all of it outstanding)- it's the art, painting, pottery, mixed media, jewelery places which display the wonderful talent in this area. Well worth the visit.
Note: nothing really opens until 12 weekdays (tea/coffee open earlier), and I am unsure about the weekends.

name: KYLE GOOS
text: This place is awesome! Haven't been back in a while , but can't wait to bring the family again. There's something there for everyone

name: Bona Indraputra
text: Great place to hang out and meet

name: Sean Hogan
text: Great cafe/ coffeehouse.  I had the minnie peanut butter cake and iced latte, it was delicious! I will love to swing by here again next time I'm in town.

name: Elizabeth Douglas
text: Fantastic venue! We loved attending the Snowball held here and look forward to other events at this location. The space was really well used and seemed like the kind of place that could be easily transformed depending on the type of event taking place. Loved the fact admission was only $10 per person. Parking was easy as the lot was spacious. Looking forward to visiting again.

name: Jerome A Powell
text: Housed in an old mill facility, Lowe Mill is the country's largest privately owned arts center. Artists of all genres have studios here and on Saturdays, the Artist Market is set up for one-time sellers to hawk their wares. The creaky wood floors hint at the building's age while modern art remind visitors of our space program ties. It's a great place to visit on Saturdays to roam and shop.

name: Myra L Walker-Williams
text: This is truly a hidden gem!! I was there for a photo shoot of my daughter with Huntsville's own Dokk Savage Photographer. He found a venue to fit exactly what she was needing. I'm planning another trip back, because you cannot possibly take in all of this awesomeness in a day. I suggest three days minimum.

name: Bryan Singer
text: This has been a real joy to watch develop over the years.  Don't miss on your trip to Huntsville!!

name: Deborah Holt
text: Benefit at Lowe Mill old cotton mill transformed into a music art venue welcomes the public all ages and brings together a community of artists weirdos and love

name: Nathan Stewart
text:
I went during comic con, but apart from the event vendors, the regular shop vendors have a ton of things to offer. The chocolate shop has amazing flavors, and there are several food places that looked delicious. We also swung by several art shops which had a lot of interesting items, and picked up some miniatures. There are several studios that offer electronic camps/lessons and art lessons, there's even a cigar guitar class.

Tl;dr; go check this place out, you'll probably find something you like.

name: Emmanuel Leonard
text: I came here on a Saturday towards the end of the day so a lot of the shops were closed. I still enjoyed my time walking around and looking at the various art pieces they had displayed. I would go again but probably in the early afternoon.

name: Mike G
text: Tons of small local artistry shops that cover a myriad of specialties along with some great little food spots. Wonderful way to waste a day and support local artists.

name: Tammy Wolfe
text:
The Halloween candy trail was great was only about 6 cars left handout candy but my grandbaby was still happy  about it
Thank to who all were there and lowe mill for doing this

name: Hector Murrieta
text: Great place to hang out, see art, listen to music, places to paint, etc. Definitely worth a visit (or a dozen).

name: S Clay
text: I love this place, many different types of art. Spent hours looking, and we even bought a small painting. Found a small place to eat and spent most of the afternoon looking!

name: Rosemary Davidson
text: So many neat little shops and artists. A treasure in the community.

name: John Beck (BeekrJR)
text: A great area for local talent to share their products and passions

name: Deitrick Smart
text: New more food places.

name: Kayla VanEtten
text: I love Lowe Mill it's gotten so much bigger! I remember when we used to call it the flying monkey and go to the market on Saturdays. I've recently purchased tickets to an "R rated magic show" there one night which was great. I also went to yule y'all and will definitely be back soon! I love so many things about this place.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Creative art center. Many talented artisans. I liked that one can learn various crafts. If you like the weird and artsy angle, plenty of that.  Some great gourmet food and chocolate confections. An experience worth checking out.

name: John Muhlhauser
text: Very cool place to spend your time in the weekend. It's free to get it, and there are many things to do and observe different kind of arts.

name: Kimberly Bowie
text: Very fun artsy environment. Comfortable Place to chill and eat. Great place to host fashion events when additional lighting is considered. Respectful, helpful staff.

name: Brian White
text: Great wholesome fun for the whole family. Perfect for a date night too. Love this place. Huntsville is lucky to have a place like this.

name: Brandie Robinson
text: I love this place!

name: Tonya Sitko
text: Very unique collection of artist studios in an old mill/factory.  Attempts have been made to retain the factory vibe/feel.  Wear good walking shoes when you visit, and leave plenty of time to explore, eat pizza, eat a popsicle, and shop!

name: D'Arcy Burgess
text: Love this place! Grab a vegan/vegetarian meal from Chef Will's while you're there! Amazing food!

name: Robert Rivera
text:
Simply, awesome and genuine ambiance for the creative mind! I wish there would be properties like this in Miami area.

Lots of options of work and talent to look & feel the work being done and sold.

The best environment I have experienced in the US.  This is a must visit! For the whole family.

Pros:
- great location in Huntsville
- ample parking
- good for the true coffee fanatic (Alchemy)!
- spaces are well laid out, studios and offices have great light and window openings to see from inside the walkway
- halls have ample walking space
- plenty of excellent food options

Cons
- none found yet!

Simply love it! Will be a definite regular customer!

name: Lapping PoofPoof
text: Nice knit stuffed kitties

name: Sally MacDonald
text: Because of covid, not much was open.  Very few artists working.  Also it was confusing to find your way around.  The diagrams on the walls were not very helpful.

name: Pitts Burgher
text: Everyone should go and see all of the local artist and crafters who have their stores set up there. Food and drink are available. Check out 5 Points Elements. Great store.

name: John VanAntwerp
text: Really nice artist venue.  I wish more places had been open.

name: Vanessa Bowser
text: Great space and really awesome vendors. We visited on a Saturday and there were artists there at working on projects. Many were very visible, friendly, and eager to discuss their work. A few food vendors located inside and there is an art supply store! I will definitely go back for another visit!

name: Sandra Yokem
text: First time there. Took my 12 year old granddaughter and WOW we had a great time

name: Gary Sheffer
text: Great eclectic environment.  Totally chill with fabulous art and good food stalls.

name: Stephen Walls
text: Hard to beat the variety of entertainment you can get for free at Lowe Mill. The drive-in night was an interestkng mix of dark comedy short films.

name: Beth Taylor
text: What a fun way to #buylocal! There's really something for everyone, whether you're trying to find a unique gift for a friend or just would like to try some fresh kombucha this is the place for you!

name: Dominique Brooks
text: Chef Will is food is Amazing

name: Kathy Edgar
text: Perfect place to fill your day. Make sure you check out the following: Piper and Leaf Tea, Chris Wade at Studio 202, White Rabbit Records, and Pizzelle's Confections.

name: Rachel Haggard
text: Love this place, wish they had this up North

name: Nathan Stewart
text:
I went during comic con, but apart from the event vendors, the regular shop vendors have a ton of things to offer. The chocolate shop has amazing flavors, and there are several food places that looked delicious. We also swung by several art shops which had a lot of interesting items, and picked up some miniatures. There are several studios that offer electronic camps/lessons and art lessons, there's even a cigar guitar class.

Tl;dr; go check this place out, you'll probably find something you like.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Creative art center. Many talented artisans. I liked that one can learn various crafts. If you like the weird and artsy angle, plenty of that.  Some great gourmet food and chocolate confections. An experience worth checking out.

name: Kimberly Midkiff
text: Lots of fine art and entertainment.

name: Tonya Sitko
text: Very unique collection of artist studios in an old mill/factory.  Attempts have been made to retain the factory vibe/feel.  Wear good walking shoes when you visit, and leave plenty of time to explore, eat pizza, eat a popsicle, and shop!

name: Justin Malone
text: I rarely get to enjoy the Mill due to my own conflicting work hours.  However, it never disappoints!  It's always an adventure here.

name: Brandie Robinson
text: I love this place!

name: Mark Stevenson
text: Great place...always something new.

name: D'Arcy Burgess
text: Love this place! Grab a vegan/vegetarian meal from Chef Will's while you're there! Amazing food!

name: Kaylee Powell
text: Such a fun, eclectic environment, and a great place to learn, take classes, or observe the creative process. Suzy's is great, and so is the happy tummy restaurant! I'll be back!

name: Claudette Patton
text: I love it here

name: Callie Livesay
text: This place is amazing for all of the cool things you can do there! Saturdays they have artist markets with local artists selling their wares, plus the permanent shops they have there. Lots of good places to eat also. They host comedy shows, music shows, even circus sideshows! It's really the most unique arts place in Huntsville

name: Thomas Garner
text: Multitude of things to do here, They have everything from pop up artist shops to a chocolate store with amazing coffee. Perfect place for a date or just a fun day trip if you are near huntsville.

name: Tamyra Sampson
text: We took pictures here.  Its a beautiful place for this.

name: Charles Wildman
text: First time at Lowe Mill, everyone should go check it out

name: Crisa Slusher
text: Get chocolate! Not only is it stunning, it's equally delicious. Great destination! Ride the elevator. Swing on the 2nd floor. Find the giant metal bug. Buy art. Have a glorious time.

name: Donna
text: Saturdays at the Mill are the best!

name: Katelyn G
text: We've been on both a weekday and Saturday. The variety of artists are nice with lots of beautiful and some unique art. There were some artists who were closed both days which was difficult to navigate if you wanted to visit them. But definitely worth visiting and taking any out of towners who are into art.

name: Roberto Fuschi
text: Really cool concept; art stores, pinball machine store ..good lunch too

name: Paul Godsey
text: Good place to look and explore

name: John Smith
text: Saturday night obscure films were exactly what they sound like: Saturday night and obscure. Really enjoyed the tradition of honking after a film finished to show interest, did not enjoy pressure to honk when I personally didn't enjoy a short film.

name: Cameron Page
text: So creative! Amazing arts center

name: bev bauer
text: Wonderful artwork friendly people in a historical environment. Not in every city rare.

name: PATRICIA MENDEZ
text: I fell in love with Lowe the first time I visited it. I sold my baked goods at the Flying Monkey Arts gig on Saturday’s. I no longer live in HSV but the 4 years I lived there we always spent time at the Mill. I’ve heard that Lowe Mill is home to the largest arts facility in the US. Go Huntsville! The swing dancing in the theater was always the cat’s pajamas!  Piper Leaf provides the best tea by far! You can buy a mason jar and get your tea it every time you visit Piper Leaf. There  is so much to do... concerts on the dock... good eats...beautiful artwork...cool studios... funky shops. I can go on but it’s best if y’all check it out y’all selves. I miss my beloved Lowe Mill. Guess I’ll have to visit soon.

name: Cheyenne Michelli
text: My second home. I have made many dear friends here over the years and I wouldn't trade the memories I have there for anything. Highly recommend! The community is extremely diverse

name: Nyki Pastuszka
text: Instead of reading my thoughts, you should already be here exploring what huntsville artists have to offer. As accessible as this hub is... you got no excuse for not visiting at least ONCE while you're in town.... and if you're a native I hope that you're only reading this because you're about to leave your own awesome review!

name: Barb Graybeal
text:
First visit to Mountain Valley Pizzeria.  We are now permanent customers!  This will be part of each visit to H'ville.  The pizza and the bread were made exactly  the way we love.  It is not your
corner pick up and run pizza.  It's a completely new experience.

name: Jose Olivero
text: Sent to have my bicycle check. Very helpful staff.

name: Jacob Benning
text: A bit out of the way, but a trip worth noting for artists or someone looking to burn an hour or two.  There's a decent amount of parking, so no worries about mile-long hikes.  Despite the rustic conditions, and an odd bat-related smell in one of the stairwells (as noted on a painted wall acknowledging the offending smell) the experience was an enjoyable one.  On each floor, the halls are lined with studios for independent artists, each as unique as a fingerprint.  Would happily return for the art and the wide range of food ranging from tea to shaorma.

name: ladyrob4110
text: I love the record store

name: Michael Pukish
text: Well, there are some quaint places that individually do specific foods, desserts, cafe stuff right, but overall there's something not quite aligned with the hype.. For certain, all the prices are more than a bit high. And it's not their fault, but I've never been there when it's "hopping with excitement".  I like the buildings and the ambience, but maybe things pick up and it takes on a new character during special events. I haven't made it there for that yet, and maybe that will change my mind.

name: HLLW
text: All the local art was probably the most fascinating thing, very calming area to be in plus the multitudes of mini businesses in the building were interesting to go by.  I would highly recommend the paper flower shop (can't remember the name of it off the top of my head) but definitely go there for a cute gift for your S.O.  They can last several years.

name: Callie Livesay
text: This place is amazing for all of the cool things you can do there! Saturdays they have artist markets with local artists selling their wares, plus the permanent shops they have there. Lots of good places to eat also. They host comedy shows, music shows, even circus sideshows! It's really the most unique arts place in Huntsville

name: Tamyra Sampson
text: We took pictures here.  Its a beautiful place for this.

name: Winston Howard
text: Love the location and the hold vibe was great. I could see this place as a causal hangout and for dates

name: Claudette Patton
text: I love it here

name: Donna
text: Saturdays at the Mill are the best!

name: Paul Godsey
text: Good place to look and explore

name: Christi Doyle
text: One of my favorite places.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator. They have a farmers market on Saturday's You can explore the inside buy art, homemade jewery, all kinds of pretty things, baked goodies, there a couple photo studios, a comic book area, a few restaurants, even get a cartoonist draw a picture of you.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator.
